recipe: Take 1 1/2 litre water in a vessel.
Add 2-3 tsp Panipuri Masala, salt, 1/2 tsp green chilli-pudina chutney.
If needed, add 1-2 tsp sweet tamarind chutney.
Use this water in puris made of fine rawa, along with khari bundi, boiled potato, salted cooked moong etc.

recipe: Boil potatoes, cut into small pieces and apply Chat Masala and chilli powder.
Stuff potato pieces into puris.

Mix well.

recipe: Take 1/2 cup thick Curd.

recipe: Fry 1 finely chopped onion, add ginger garlic paste and cook for few minutes.

recipe: Heat 1 tbs butter in a pan, add finely chopped onions and garlic ginger paste and saute it for 2 minutes.
Add Chilli powder, salt, 1tbs SURUCHIRAJ Frankie masala, two boiled smashed potatoes to make stuffing.
Put one butter applied chapati on tava and spread above stuffing mixture on it.
Now sprinkle cheese on it and roll tightly to serve.

recipe: Take 8-10 fresh thick red or green chillies.
Make a single slit lengthwise in each and fry in oil for 1 min to remove moisture.
For stuffing, mix 2 tbsp Stuffed Chilli Pickle Masala, salt, chilli powder (if needed) and oil.
Stuff the slit chillies with this mixture.
Mix hot oil with the leftover stuffing mixture and store in an airtight glass container.

recipe: Soak 2tbsp Pandhra Rassa Masala and 8-10 cashew nuts separately in water for 10 min.
Mix it and make a fine paste of the masala and add some water in it and strain it and keep it aside.
In a pan take 1 tbsp oil and fry 1 vertically sliced onion for 1 min.
Make a fine paste of it.
In a pan heat oil add 2-3 cloves & bay leaves and then add onion paste and 1 green chilli if needed and fry it till it leaves oil.
Then add the strained masala water in it.
Then add hot chicken or mutton stock, coconut thin milk and boil it for 2-3 min.
Then add coconut thick milk and mix well only for 1 min.

recipe: Roughly chop 1 medium bell pepper, add 10-12 springs of coriander, 1 1/2 tbsp oil, salt to taste and 2 tbsp Suruchiraj paste.
Transfer sauce into a bowl.
Heat oil in a non-stick grill pan.
Cut 250 grms paneer and 1 large oiled potato into thick slices.
Dip it in the Peri Peri sauce and grill it on the pan till it is done.
Serve it with salad.
Tip: Suruchiraj Peri Peri Spice mix can also be used on Potato French fries.

recipe: Marinate mutton with ginger, garlic, coriander leaves paste & keep it aside for 15 min.
Heat oil in a kadhai and add 3 chopped onions and fry till it turns golden brown.
Make fine paste of onions along with 2tbsp Suruchiraj Tambda Rassa Masala.
Heat in a pressure cooker and pour remaining oil in it.
Now sauté 1 vertically sliced onion in it then add turmeric powder and (chilli powder if necessary).
Then add marinated mutton in it and sauté it for 5 min then add masala paste and salt.
Mix it properly and cook it till it leaves oil.
Then pour 3 cups of water in it pressure cook it upto 1-2 whistles.
Garnish it with coriander.

recipe: Heat oil in a vessel, add cloves, cardamoms and chopped onions.

recipe: Soak the kabuli chana in water overnight.

Masalabhat recipe: In 1 cup curd, add 1-2 tsp Goda Masala, ginger-garlic paste, green chillies, potatoes, salt, turmeric powder, lemon juice.

why_you_will_love_it: Simple to make, packed with nutrients.

recipe: In a vessel, take 2 to 3 tbs oil, add 2 finely chopped onions and green chillies till it turns brown.
Then add 1tbsp ginger-garlic paste & 1tbsp Suruchiraj Kheema masala.
Put 1/4 tbsp turmeric powder, 1 tbsp red chilli powder, 1 chopped tomato, salt as per taste and cook for 5mins.
Then add 250grms of cooked Kheema and chopped coriander.
Mix well and cook for 10mins.

recipe: Add 1tsp in your tea.
Add it in warm water and drink .
For a good immunity simply have 1tsp with honey daily.

recipe: Apply turmeric and salt to 1 kg of mango pieces.
Add 1 packet Mango Pickle Masala and mix well.
Heat 1/2 liter oil in a vessel, add mustard seeds and switch off flame once it starts popping.
Add ½ tsp turmeric powder and 1 tsp asoeftida.
Let it cool and then add the mango mixture.
Store pickle in airtight container.
